page.title: 06THE HOBBY OF A KEELBY CHILD
page.content: My name is Paul Webster, I am 11 years old and I am in the top year.One of my favourite dates which comes every month is the day I go to Astronomy Club in Cleethorpes, a nearby town. Altogether there are about 60 members of the club, just 5 of which are children.I've been going there for 1\ years, and intend to continue. We have a long talk with the lecturer, and he usually brings things like old car axles and tells you how to make a first class telescope out of them (the clubs telescope is made out of a car axle and other car pieces). At the last meeting he brought a gas pump and a speckled balloon.He pumped up the balloon, and you keep your eyes on a dot.All the dots move away from it.This demonstrates why all the other galaxys seem to be moving away from ours.
